1.SceneDescription: Museum of Prehistoric History, Ross and a co-workerNEWLINE(Marsha) are setting up an exhibit which includes some mannequins of cave people.

lines.Line: No, it's good, it is good, it's just that- mm- doesn't she seem a littleNEWLINEangry?
He's out banging other women over the head with a club, while she sitsNEWLINEat home trying to get the mastodon smell out of the carpet!
Marsha, these are cave people. Okay? They have issues like 'Gee, thatNEWLINEglacier's getting kinda close.' See?
Speaking of issues, isn't that your ex-wife?
Speaking of issues, isn't that your ex-wife?

lines.Character: (Carol, Ross's ex-wife, has entered behind them and is standing outstide the exhibit.
lines.Line: Carol, Ross's ex-wife, has entered behind them and is standing outstide the exhibit.)
Okay, okay, yes, it is. (waves) How about I'll, uh, catch up with you inNEWLINEthe Ice Age.

lines.Character: (Marsha extis and Ross waves Carol into the exhibit.
lines.Line: Marsha extis and Ross waves Carol into the exhibit.)

lines.Character: (Marsha extis and Ross waves Carol into the exhibit.
lines.Line: Marsha extis and Ross waves Carol into the exhibit.)
You look great. I, uh... I hate that.
Ah, well, in here, anyone who... stands erect... So what's new? Still,NEWLINEuh...
Well... you never know. How's, um.. how's the family?
Marty's still totally paranoid. Oh, and, uh-
Marty's still totally paranoid. Oh, and, uh-
Why- why are you here, Carol?
Why- why are you here, Carol?
Your folks are really that bad, huh?
Well, y'know, these people are pros. They know what they're doing, theyNEWLINEtake their time, they get the job done.
Boy, I know they say you can't change your parents,... boy, if youNEWLINEcould- (To Ross) -I'd want yours.
Y'know, it's even worse when you're twins.
Yeah. We don't speak. She's like this high-powered, driven career type.
All right, you guys, I kinda gotta clean up now. (They all start toNEWLINEleave.)
Chandler, you're an only child, right? You don't have any of this.
Chandler, you're an only child, right? You don't have any of this.
Well, no, although I did have an imaginary friend, who... my parentsNEWLINEactually preferred.

lines.Character: (Joey turns off the lights, and they all leave as Rachel starts to clean up.  RossNEWLINEenters from the bathroom.
lines.Line: Joey turns off the lights, and they all leave as Rachel starts to clean up.  RossNEWLINEenters from the bathroom.)
D'ya.. uh.. d'ya need any help?
D'ya.. uh.. d'ya need any help?
Uh.. okay, sure! Thanks! (She hands him the broom and sits down.)
Anyway.. um.. (Starts to sweep.) So, you- uh- you nervous about BarryNEWLINEtomorrow?
So, got any advice? Y'know, as someone who's recently been- dumped?

Well, you may wanna steer clear of the word 'dumped'. Chances are he'sNEWLINEgonna be this, this broken shell of a man, y'know, so you should try not to look tooNEWLINEterrific, I know it'll be hard. Or, y'know, uh, hey!, I'll go down there, and I'll giveNEWLINEBarry back his ring, and you can go with Carol and Susan to the OB/GYN...
Oh, you've got Carol tomorrow.. When did it get so complicated?
Oh, you've got Carol tomorrow.. When did it get so complicated?
Remember when we were in high school together?
I mean, didn't you think you were just gonna meet somone, fall in love-NEWLINEand that'd be it? (Ross gazes at her.) ..Ross?
Oh! Man, I never thought I'd be here.. (She leans back onto his hand.)
Me either... (He pulls up a stool so that he doesn't have to move hisNEWLINEhand.)

3.SceneDescription: Carol's OB/GYN, they're talking about how this is going to work.

lines.Line: So, um- so how's this, uh, how's this gonna work? Y'know, with us? Y'know,NEWLINEwhen, like, important decisions have to be made?
Well, uh, uh, I don't know, okay, okay, how about with the, uh, with theNEWLINEbaby's name?
-if it's a boy, Minnie if it's a girl.
Still, you- you say Minnie, you hear Mouse. Um, how about, um.. how aboutNEWLINEJulia?
'S'funny, um, uh, we agreed we'd spend the rest of our lives together.NEWLINEThings change, roll with the punches. I believe Julia's on the table..?

4.SceneDescription: Carol's OB/GYN, they're still arguing about what to name the baby.

lines.Line: Oh, please! What's wrong with Helen?
Helen Geller? I don't think so.
Helen Geller? I don't think so.
Hello? It's not gonna be Helen Geller.
No, I mean it's not Geller.
No, I mean it's not Geller.
What, it's gonna be Helen Willick?
No, actually, um, we talked about Helen Willick-Bunch.
Well, wait a minute, wha- why is she in the title?
Well, wait a minute, wha- why is she in the title?
Oh, 's'funny, really? Um, I don't remember you making any sperm.
Yeah, and we all know what a challenge that is!
Yeah, and we all know what a challenge that is!
All right, you two, stop it!
All right, you two, stop it!
No no no, she gets a credit, hey, I'm in there too.
Ross. You're not actually suggesting Helen Willick-Bunch-Geller? 'Cause INEWLINEthink that borders on child abuse.
Of course not, I'm... suggesting Geller-Willick-Bunch.
Of course not, I'm... suggesting Geller-Willick-Bunch.
Oh, no, nonononono, you see what he's doing? He knows no-one's gonna sayNEWLINEall those names, so they'll wind up calling her Geller, then he gets his way!

My way?! You-you think this is my way? Believe me, of all the ways I everNEWLINEimagined this moment in my life being, this is not my way- y'know what? Uh, um, this isNEWLINEtoo hard. I'm not, I can't do-
(entering) Knock knock!How are we today? Any nausea?
(entering) Knock knock!How are we today? Any nausea?
Well, I was just wondering about the mother-to-be, but.. thanks forNEWLINEsharing. (To Carol) Uh, lie back..
You- uh- y'know what, I'm gonna go. I don't- I don't think I can beNEWLINEinvolved in this particular thing right now.

lines.Character: (He turns to go, but the sound of the sonogram catches hes ear.  He returns andNEWLINEstares at it
lines.Line: He turns to go, but the sound of the sonogram catches hes ear.  He returns andNEWLINEstares at it.
